","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_localfunction","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This ensures that functions defined within the project—but not explicitly called from the main entry points—are still fully analyzed for internal data flow.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1f93a0c3-b6e8-4dc2-a6a9-967e63606474","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"f9c62179-8de0-401b-b11a-7430579d279e","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Insight","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f5a8012e-74f9-496f-87e1-bea8d1e7a40f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This method is the point where ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Static Analysis","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" meets ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Dynamic Dependency Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". By wrapping the processor's activity with import hooks, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"do_pass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows Jarvis to jump between files as it encounters imports, building a project-wide model rather than just a single-file report.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8eb23056-0e6e-47a1-9887-855c3a898531","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b6837530-19a9-4137-ac5e-4195ffc0a8de","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Avoiding Redundancy","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By maintaining the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"modules_analyzed","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" set across entry points, the method ensures that if multiple entry points import the same utility module, that module is only parsed once.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b1e2ffbd-b131-4762-b0b1-05c68434085d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Project Completeness","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The final loop over ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.moduleEntry","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is critical; it ensures that even \"dead code\" or unused library functions within the project are analyzed, providing a comprehensive view of the codebase's potential behavior.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b661cc0b-7421-4e32-89d6-49f22aac1a45","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace Integrity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By normalizing module names via ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_get_mod_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" before processing, the method ensures that all internal managers use the same canonical identifiers for functions and classes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"38f8fe70-1302-4451-af28-e0a929cd18ae","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
